intro: Hieracium subdurifrons, commonly known as the rough-haired hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow daisy-like flowers and hairy, often reddish stems. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this perennial plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, stiff hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
